code: @Manual{,   title = {GDSARM: Gauss - Dantzig Selector: Aggregation over Random Models},   author = {Rakhi Singh and John Stufken},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/agrakhi/GDSARM}, }

title: Gauss - Dantzig Selector: Aggregation over Random Models
text: Screening experiments useful screening small number truly impor- tant factors large number potentially important factors. Gauss-Dantzig Selector (GDS) often preferred analysis method screening experiments. Just considering main-effects models can result erroneous conclusions, including - teraction terms, even restricted two-factor interactions, increases number model terms dramatically challenges GDS analysis. propose new analysis method, called Gauss-Dantzig Selector Aggregation Random Models (GDS-ARM), performs GDS analysis multiple models include randomly selected interactions. Please see Singh Stufken (2022) details.

title: Gauss - Dantzig Selector: Aggregation over Random Models
text: package available CRAN. programs stable development phase. major changes include factors two-levels added time.

title: Gauss - Dantzig Selector: Aggregation over Random Models
text: latest version package development can installed GitHub:

title: Gauss - Dantzig Selector: Aggregation over Random Models
text: Please submit bugs issues (suggestions) using issues tab repo.

title: Gauss - Dantzig Selector: Aggregation over Random Models
text: main functions users use GDSARM GDS_givencols. GDSARM main method. GDS_givencols helper function helps user run GDS main effects main effects plus two-factor interactions. Check vignettes examples details.
code: library(GDSARM)  data(dataHamadaWu) X = dataHamadaWu[,-8] Y= dataHamadaWu[,8] delta.n=10 n = dim(X)[1] m = dim(X)[2] nint = ceiling(0.2*choose(m,2)) nrep = choose(m,2) ntop = max(20, nint*nrep/(2*choose(m,2))) pkeep = 0.25  cri.penter = 0.01 cri.premove = 0.05 design = X # GDS-ARM with default values GDSARM(delta.n,nint, nrep, ntop,pkeep, X, Y,cri.penter, cri.premove)  # GDS-ARM with default values but with weak heredity opt.heredity="weak"  GDSARM(delta.n,nint, nrep, ntop,pkeep, X,Y,cri.penter, cri.premove,opt.heredity)   data(dataHamadaWu) X = dataHamadaWu[,-8] Y= dataHamadaWu[,8] delta.n=10 # GDS on main effects  GDS_givencols(delta.n,design = X, Y=Y, which.cols = "main")  # GDS on main effects and two-factor interactions GDS_givencols(delta.n,design = X, Y=Y)

title: Gauss - Dantzig Selector: Aggregation over Random Models

title: Gauss - Dantzig Selector: Aggregation over Random Models

what: Gauss-Dantzig Selector - Aggregation over Random Models (GDS-ARM) — GDSARM
title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector - Aggregation over Random Models (GDS-ARM) — GDSARM
text: GDS-ARM procedure consists three steps. First, runs Gauss Dantzig Selector (GDS) nrep times, time different set nint randomly selected two-factor interactions. m main effects included GDS run. Second, best ntop models identified smallest BIC. Effects appear least pkeep x ntop ntop models passed third stage. third stage, stepwise regression used. n number runs, stepwise regression starts n-3 selected effects previous step. remaining effects previous step well main effects given chance enter model using forward-backward stepwise regression. function also option using modified GDS-ARM. modified version incorporates effect heredity two steps, first, model found GDS, ignore active interactions least one main effects active (weak heredity) main effects active (strong heredity); second, model found stepwise stage GDS-ARM.

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector - Aggregation over Random Models (GDS-ARM) — GDSARM
code: GDSARM(   delta.n = 10,   nint,   nrep,   ntop,   pkeep,   design,   Y,   cri.penter = 0.01,   cri.premove = 0.05,   opt.heredity = c("none"),   seedvalue = 1234 )

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector - Aggregation over Random Models (GDS-ARM) — GDSARM
text: Cand\`es, E. Tao, T. (2007). Dantzig selector: Statistical estimation p much larger n. Annals Statistics 35 (6), 2313--2351. Dopico-Garc\' ia, M.S., Valentao, P., Guerra, L., Andrade, P. B., Seabra, R. M. (2007). Experimental design extraction quantification phenolic compounds organic acids white "Vinho Verde" grapes Analytica Chimica Acta, 583(1): 15--22. Hamada, M. Wu, C. F. J. (1992). Analysis designed experiments complex aliasing. Journal Quality Technology 24 (3), 130--137. Hunter, G. B., Hodi, F. S. Eagar, T. W. (1982). High cycle fatigue weld repaired cast Ti-6AI-4V. Metallurgical Transactions 13 (9), 1589--1594. Phoa, F. K., Pan, Y. H. Xu, H. (2009). Analysis supersaturated designs via Dantzig selector. Journal Statistical Planning Inference 139 (7), 2362--2372. Singh, R. Stufken, J. (2022). Factor selection screening experiments aggregation random models, 1--31. doi:10.48550/arXiv.2205.13497

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector - Aggregation over Random Models (GDS-ARM) — GDSARM
text: delta.n positive integer suggesting number delta values tried. delta.n equally spaced values delta used strictly 0 max(|t(X)y|). default value set 10. nint positive integer representing number randomly chosen interactions. suggested value use ceiling 20% total number interactions, , m factors, ceiling(0.2(m choose 2)). nrep positive integer representing number times GDS run. suggested value (m choose 2). ntop positive integer representing number top models selected among nrep models. suggested value max(20, (nrep x nint)/(m(m-1)). value ntop exceed nrep. pkeep number 0 1 representing proportion ntop models effect needs appear order selected stepwise regression stage. design \(n \times m\) matrix m two-level factors. levels coded +1 -1. Y vector n responses. cri.penter p-value cutoff significant effect enter stepwise regression model. suggested value 0.01. cri.premove p-value cutoff least significant effect exit stepwise regression model. suggested value 0.05. opt.heredity string either none, weak, strong. Denotes whether effect-heredity (weak strong) embedded GDS-ARM. default value none suggested Singh Stufken (2022). seedvalue seed value fix set interactions selected. default value seed 1234.

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector - Aggregation over Random Models (GDS-ARM) — GDSARM
text: list returning selected effects well corresponding important factors.

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector - Aggregation over Random Models (GDS-ARM) — GDSARM
code: data(dataHamadaWu) X = dataHamadaWu[,-8] Y = dataHamadaWu[,8] delta.n = 10 n = dim(X)[1] m = dim(X)[2] nint = ceiling(0.2*choose(m,2)) nrep = choose(m,2) ntop = max(20, nint*nrep/(2*choose(m,2))) pkeep = 0.25  cri.penter = 0.01 cri.premove = 0.05 design = X # GDS-ARM with default values GDSARM(delta.n, nint, nrep, ntop, pkeep, X, Y, cri.penter, cri.premove) #> $effects #> [1] "V6"    "V1:V5" "V6:V7" #>  #> $factors #> [1] "V6" "V1" "V5" "V7" #>   # GDS-ARM with default values but with weak heredity opt.heredity="weak"  GDSARM(delta.n, nint, nrep, ntop, pkeep, X, Y, cri.penter, cri.premove, opt.heredity) #> $effects #> [1] "V6"    "V6:V7" #>  #> $factors #> [1] "V6" "V7" #>    data(dataCompoundExt) X = dataCompoundExt[,-9] Y = dataCompoundExt[,9] delta.n = 10 n = dim(X)[1] m = dim(X)[2] nint = ceiling(0.2*choose(m,2)) nrep = choose(m,2) ntop = max(20, nint*nrep/(2*choose(m,2))) pkeep = 0.25  cri.penter = 0.01 cri.premove = 0.05 design = X # GDS-ARM on compound extraction GDSARM(delta.n, nint, nrep, ntop, pkeep, X, Y, cri.penter, cri.premove) #> $effects #> [1] "V4"    "V3"    "V1:V4" #>  #> $factors #> [1] "V4" "V3" "V1" #>   # GDS-ARM on compound extraction with strong heredity opt.heredity = "strong" GDSARM(delta.n, nint, nrep, ntop, pkeep, X, Y, cri.penter, cri.premove, opt.heredity) #> $effects #> [1] "V4" "V3" #>  #> $factors #> [1] "V4" "V3" #>

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector — GDS_givencols
text: function runs Gauss-Dantzig selector given columns. two options: either () GDS(m) m main effects, (b) GDS(m+2fi) m main effects corresponding two-factor interactions. given delta, DS minimizes L_1-norm (sum absolute values) beta subject constraint max(|t(X)(y-X * beta)|) <= delta. GDS run multiple values delta. use kmeans BIC select best model.

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector — GDS_givencols
Gauss-Dantzig Selector — GDS_givencols
text: Cand\`es, E. Tao, T. (2007). Dantzig selector: Statistical estimation p much larger n. Annals Statistics 35 (6), 2313--2351. Dopico-Garc\' ia, M.S., Valentao, P., Guerra, L., Andrade, P. B., Seabra, R. M. (2007). Experimental design extraction quantification phenolic compounds organic acids white "Vinho Verde" grapes Analytica Chimica Acta, 583(1): 15--22. Hamada, M. Wu, C. F. J. (1992). Analysis designed experiments complex aliasing. Journal Quality Technology 24 (3), 130--137. Hunter, G. B., Hodi, F. S. Eagar, T. W. (1982). High cycle fatigue weld repaired cast Ti-6AI-4V. Metallurgical Transactions 13 (9), 1589--1594. Phoa, F. K., Pan, Y. H. Xu, H. (2009). Analysis supersaturated designs via Dantzig selector. Journal Statistical Planning Inference 139 (7), 2362--2372. Singh, R. Stufken, J. (2022). Factor selection screening experiments aggregation random models, 1--31. doi:10.48550/arXiv.2205.13497

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector — GDS_givencols
text: delta.n positive integer suggesting number delta values tried. delta.n equally spaced values delta used strictly 0 max(|t(X)y|). default value set 10. design \(n \times m\) matrix m two-level factors. levels coded +1 -1. Y vector n responses. .cols string either main main2fi. Denotes whether Gauss-Dantzig Selector run main effect columns (main), main effects plus 2 factor interaction columns (main2fi). default value main2fi.

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector — GDS_givencols
text: list returning selected effects well corresponding important factors.

title: Gauss-Dantzig Selector — GDS_givencols
code: data(dataHamadaWu) X = dataHamadaWu[,-8] Y = dataHamadaWu[,8] delta.n = 10 # GDS on main effects  GDS_givencols(delta.n, design = X, Y=Y, which.cols = "main") #> $effects #> [1] "V6" #>  #> $factors #> [1] "V6" #>   # GDS on main effects and two-factor interactions GDS_givencols(delta.n, design = X, Y=Y) #> $effects #> [1] "V6"    "V1:V5" "V6:V7" #>  #> $factors #> [1] "V6" "V1" "V5" "V7" #>   data(dataCompoundExt) X = dataCompoundExt[,-9] Y = dataCompoundExt[,9] delta.n = 10 # GDS on main effects GDS_givencols(delta.n, design = X, Y=Y, which.cols = "main") #> $effects #> [1] "V2" "V4" "V5" "V6" #>  #> $factors #> [1] "V2" "V4" "V5" "V6" #>  # GDS on main effects and two-factor interactions GDS_givencols(delta.n, design = X, Y=Y, which.cols = "main2fi") #> $effects #> [1] "V2"    "V4"    "V1:V4" "V1:V8" "V2:V5" "V7:V8" #>  #> $factors #> [1] "V2" "V4" "V1" "V8" "V5" "V7" #>

what: Step III: Stepwise on the consolidated output from different GDS runs — StepIII_stepwise
title: Step III: Stepwise on the consolidated output from different GDS runs — StepIII_stepwise
text: Runs stepwise regression output received top models consolidated output different GDS runs. n number runs, stepwise regression starts (n-3) selected effects previous step. remaining effects previous step well main effects given chance enter model using forward-backward stepwise regression.

title: Step III: Stepwise on the consolidated output from different GDS runs — StepIII_stepwise
code: StepIII_stepwise(   xstart,   xremain,   Xmain,   Xint,   Y,   cri.penter = 0.01,   cri.premove = 0.05,   opt.heredity = "none" )

title: Step III: Stepwise on the consolidated output from different GDS runs — StepIII_stepwise
text: Singh, R. Stufken, J. (2022). Factor selection screening experiments aggregation random models, 1--31. doi:10.48550/arXiv.2205.13497

title: Step III: Stepwise on the consolidated output from different GDS runs — StepIII_stepwise
text: xstart vector effects' names corresponding starting model. xremain vector effects' names corresponding remaining main effects effects needs explored stepwise regression. Xmain \(n \times m\) matrix m main effects. Xint matrix m choose 2 two-factor interactions. Y vector n responses. cri.penter p-value cutoff significant effect enter stepwise regression model cri.premove p-value cutoff least significant effect exit stepwise regression model opt.heredity string either none, weak, strong. Denotes whether effect-heredity (weak strong) embedded GDS-ARM. default value none suggested Singh Stufken (2022).

title: Step III: Stepwise on the consolidated output from different GDS runs — StepIII_stepwise
text: list returning selected effects well corresponding important factors.

what: Step I: Multiple GDS runs with random interactions — StepI_chooseints
title: Step I: Multiple GDS runs with random interactions — StepI_chooseints
text: Runs Gauss Dantzig Selector (GDS) multiple times, time different set randomly selected two-factor interactions. m main effects included GDS run. set randomly selected interactions, best GDS output chosen among delta.n values delta. use kmeans 2 clusters BIC select best model.

title: Step I: Multiple GDS runs with random interactions — StepI_chooseints
code: StepI_chooseints(   delta.n = 10,   nint,   nrep,   Xmain,   Xint,   Y,   opt.heredity = c("none") )

title: Step I: Multiple GDS runs with random interactions — StepI_chooseints
text: Singh, R. Stufken, J. (2022). Factor selection screening experiments aggregation random models, 1--31. doi:10.48550/arXiv.2205.13497

title: Step I: Multiple GDS runs with random interactions — StepI_chooseints
text: delta.n positive integer suggesting number delta values tried. delta.n equally spaced values delta used strictly 0 max(|t(X)y|). default value set 10. nint positive integer representing number randomly chosen interactions. suggested value use ceiling 20% total number interactions, , m factors, ceiling(0.2(m choose 2)). nrep positive integer representing number times GDS run. suggested value (m choose 2). Xmain \(n \times m\) matrix m main effects. Xint matrix \({m \choose 2}\) two-factor interactions. Y vector n responses. opt.heredity string either none, weak, strong. Denotes whether effect-heredity (weak strong) embedded GDS-ARM. default value none suggested Singh Stufken (2022).

title: Step I: Multiple GDS runs with random interactions — StepI_chooseints
text: list containing () matrix output GDS run row representing selected effects corresponding GDS run, (b) vector corresponding BIC values model.

what: Dantzig selector with an option to make profile plot — dantzig.delta
title: Dantzig selector with an option to make profile plot — dantzig.delta
text: Dantzig selector (DS) finds solution model parameters linear model, beta using linear programming. given delta, DS minimizes L_1-norm (sum absolute values) beta subject constraint max(|t(X)(y-X * beta)|) <= delta.

what: Compound Extraction experiment of Dopico-Garc\' ia et al. (2007) — dataCompoundExt
title: Compound Extraction experiment of Dopico-Garc\' ia et al. (2007) — dataCompoundExt
text: analytical experiment conducted Dopico-Garc\' ia et al. (2007) characterize chemical composition white grapes simultaneously determining important phenolic compounds organic acids grapes. example studied Phoa et al. (2009b) one phenolic compound, kaempferol-3-Orutinoside + isorhamnetin-3-O glucoside, also studied. accepted data fitting main-effects model suggests V3 (Factor C), V4 (Factor D), interaction V1:V4 (:D) active effects.
